intro: Oxytropis shivae, commonly known as Shiv's locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America, particularly in California and Nevada. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. It produces small, hard pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oxytropis shivae is adapted to thrive in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and grassland habitats.
